get.description:
Endpoint used by participants to discover the CDR Register OpenID configuration and obtain information needed to interact with it, including its OAuth 2.0 endpoint locations.

This endpoint does not require CORS.

200.description: The OpenID Provider Configuration Metadata values

get.description:
JWKS endpoint containing the public keys used by the CDR Register to validate the signature of issued SSAs and authenticate outbound calls to participants in the CDR.

This endpoint does not require CORS.

200.description: A JSON object that represents a set of JWKs

get.description:
Allows Data Recipients to discover Data Holder Brands available in the CDR ecosystem.

Obsolete versions: [v1](includes/obsolete/get-data-holder-brands-v1.html)

parameters.description: The industry the participant is retrieving data for (Banking, etc)
parameters.name: industry

parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per **[[RFC6750]](#nref-RFC6750)**.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer. The Register should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If the value of [x-min-v](#request-headers) is equal to or higher than the value of [x-v](#request-headers) then the [x-min-v](#request-headers) header should be treated as absent. If all versions requested are not supported then the Register must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable. See [HTTP Headers](#request-headers)
parameters.name: x-v

parameters.description: Minimum version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer if provided. The Register should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If all versions requested are not supported then the Register must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable.
parameters.name: x-min-v

parameters.description: query filter returns results updated since the specified date-time
parameters.name: updated-since

parameters.description: the page number to return
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: the number of records to return per page
parameters.name: page-size

x-v.description: The version of the API end point that the CDR Register has responded with.

400.description: Missing Required Header / Invalid Version / Invalid Path Parameter

get.description:
Get a Software Statement Assertion (SSA) for a software product on the CDR Register to be used for Dynamic Client Registration with a Data Holder Brand.

Obsolete versions: [v1](includes/obsolete/get-software-statement-assertion-v1.html), [v2](includes/obsolete/get-software-statement-assertion-v2.html)

parameters.description: The industry the participant is retrieving data for (Banking, etc)
parameters.name: industry

parameters.description: Version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer. The Register should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If the value of [x-min-v](#request-headers) is equal to or higher than the value of [x-v](#request-headers) then the [x-min-v](#request-headers) header should be treated as absent. If all versions requested are not supported then the Register must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable. See [HTTP Headers](#request-headers)
parameters.name: x-v

parameters.description: Minimum version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer if provided. The Register should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If all versions requested are not supported then the Register must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable.
parameters.name: x-min-v

parameters.description: Unique id for the Accredited Data Recipient Brand that the Software Product is associated with in the CDR Register
parameters.name: dataRecipientBrandId

parameters.description: Unique id for the Accredited Data Recipient Software Product in the CDR Register
parameters.name: softwareProductId

parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per **[[RFC6750]](#nref-RFC6750)**.
parameters.name: Authorization

x-v.description: The version of the API end point that the CDR Register has responded with.

400.description: Missing Required Header / Invalid Version / Invalid Path Parameter

ResponseOpenIDProviderConfigMetadata.description: Response containing the Open ID Provider Configuration Metadata

issuer.description: URL using the https scheme with no query or fragment component that the CDR Register asserts as its Issuer Identifier

jwks_uri.description: URL of the CDR Register's JSON Web Key Set **[[JWK]](#nref-JWK)** document. This contains the signing key(s) used to validate access tokens issued from the CDR Register. Note that this differs from the JWKS endpoint used to validate SSAs and CDR Register client authentication

token_endpoint.description: URL of the CDR Register's OAuth 2.0 Token Endpoint

claims_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the Claim Names of the Claims that the CDR Register supplies values for

id_token_signing_alg_values_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) supported by the CDR Register for the ID Token to encode the Claims in a JWT. Given the CDR Register does not issue ID tokens, this field can be safely ignored

subject_types_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the Subject Identifier types that the CDR Register supports. Given the CDR Register does not issue ID tokens, this field can be safely ignored

code_challenge_methods_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) **[[RFC7636]](#nref-RFC7636)** code challenge methods supported by this authorization server. Given the CDR Register does not support PKCE, this field can be safely ignored

scopes_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the OAuth 2.0 **[[RFC6749]](#nref-RFC6749)** scope values that the CDR Register supports

response_types_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the OAuth 2.0 response_type values that the CDR Registrer supports

grant_types_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the OAuth 2.0 Grant Type values that the CDR Register supports

token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of Client Authentication methods supported by this Token Endpoint

tls_client_certificate_bound_access_toke.description: Boolean value indicating server support for mutual TLS client certificate bound access tokens

token_endpoint_auth_signing_alg_values_s.description: JSON array containing a list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) supported by the token endpoint for the signature on the JWT **[[JWT]](#nref-JWT)** used to authenticate the client at the token endpoint for the "private_key_jwt" authentication method

ResponseJWKS.description: Response containing the JSON Web Key Set

keys.description: The value of the "keys" parameter is an array of JWK values

JWK.description: Object representing a JSON Web Key

alg.description: The "alg" (algorithm) parameter identifies the algorithm intended for use with the key

key_ops.description: The "key_ops" (key operations) parameter identifies the operation(s) for which the key is intended to be used

kid.description: The "kid" (key ID) parameter is partially used to match a specific key. Note the "kid" parameter is not guaranteed unique and additional parameters should be used to progressively to identify a key within a set

kty.description: The "kty" (key type) parameter identifies the cryptographic algorithm family used with the key

ResponseRegisterDataHolderBrandList.description: Response containing a list of CDR Register Data Holder Brand objects

dataHolderBrandId.description: Unique id of the Data Holder Brand issued by the CDR Register

brandName.description: The name of Data Holder Brand

industries.description: The industries the Data Holder Brand belongs to

lastUpdated.description: The date/time that the Data Holder Brand data was last updated in the Register

dataHolderBrandId.description: Unique id of the Data Holder Brand issued by the CDR Register

interimId.description: Interim id of the Data Holder Brand issued by the CDR Register. This is to be used to uniquely identify the record when dataHolderBrandId is not populated and is not to be reused

brandName.description: The name of Data Holder Brand

publicBaseUri.description: Base URI for the Data Holder's Consumer Data Standard public endpoints

industries.description: The industries the Data Holder Brand belongs to

lastUpdated.description: The date/time that the Data Holder Brand data was last updated in the Register

abn.description: Australian Business Number for the organisation

acn.description: Australian Company Number for the organisation

arbn.description: Australian Registered Body Number.  ARBNs are issued to registrable Australian bodies and foreign companies

legalEntityId.description: Unique id of the Data Holder Legal Entity issued by the CDR Register.

status.description: Data Holder status in the CDR Register

softwareProductId.description: Unique id of the software product issued by the CDR Register

status.description: Software product status in the CDR Register

legalEntityId.description: Unique id of the Data Recipient Legal Entity issued by the CDR Register

status.description: Data Recipient status in the CDR Register

ResponseRegisterDataRecipientList.description: Response containing a list of Data Recipients in the CDR Register

legalEntityId.description: Unique id of the Data Recipient Legal Entity issued by the CDR Register.

legalEntityName.description: Legal name of the Data Recipient

accreditationNumber.description: CDR Register issued human readable unique number given to Data Recipients upon accreditation

accreditationLevel.description: Accreditation level of the Data Recipient in the CDR Register

status.description: Data Recipient status in the CDR Register

lastUpdated.description: The date/time that the Legal Entity was last updated in the CDR Register

DataRecipientBrandMetaData.description: Metadata related to Data Recipient Brand

dataRecipientBrandId.description: Unique id of the Data Recipient brand issued by the CDR Register

status.description: Data Recipient Brand status in the CDR Register

softwareProductId.description: Unique id of the Data Recipient software product issued by the CDR Register

status.description: Software Product status in the CDR Register

LegalEntityDetail.description: The data that is common to all organisations, regardless of the type (e.g. company, trust, partnership, government)

legalEntityId.description: Unique id of the organisation issued by the CDR Register

legalEntityName.description: Unique legal name of the organisation

registrationNumber.description: Unique registration number (if the company is registered outside Australia)

registrationDate.description: Date of registration (if the company is registered outside Australia)

registeredCountry.description: Country of registration (if the company is registered outside Australia)

abn.description: Australian Business Number for the organisation

acn.description: Australian Company Number for the organisation

arbn.description: Australian Registered Body Number.  ARBNs are issued to registrable Australian bodies and foreign companies

RegisterDataHolderBrandServiceEndpoint.description: Endpoints related to Data Holder Brand services

version.description: The major version of the high level standards. This is not the version of the endpoint or the payload being requested but the version of the overall standards being applied. This version number will be "v" followed by the major version of the standards as a positive integer (e.g. v1, v12 or v76)

publicBaseUri.description: Base URI for the Data Holder's Consumer Data Standard public endpoints

resourceBaseUri.description: Base URI for the Data Holder's Consumer Data Standard resource endpoints

infosecBaseUri.description: Base URI for the Data Holder's Consumer Data Standard information security endpoints

extensionBaseUri.description: Base URI for the Data Holder extension endpoints to the Consumer Data Standard (optional)

websiteUri.description: Publicly available website or web resource URI

RegisterDataHolderAuth.description: Defines the mechanism used and associated endpoints for Data Holder to Data Recipient authentication

registerUType.description: The type of authentication and authorisation mechanism in use

jwksEndpoint.description: JWKS endpoint used for authentication by the Data Holder with the Data Recipient

first.description: URI to the first page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

last.description: URI to the last page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

next.description: URI to the next page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

prev.description: URI to the previous page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

self.description: Fully qualified link to this API call

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in the full set

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the full set

self.description: Fully qualified link to this API call

MetaError.description: Additional data for customised error codes

urn.description: The CDR error code URN which the application-specific error code extends. Mandatory if the error `code` is an application-specific error rather than a standardised error code.

code.description: The code of the error encountered. Where the error is specific to the respondent, an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value. If the error is application-specific, the URN code that the specific error extends must be provided in the meta object. Otherwise, the value is the error code URN.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that MUST NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem represented by the error code.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
